synopsis

It is a show of breathtaking ball . On 2 DVDs , the documentary FIFA Fever - Best of History of Soccer brings stunning images of all 17 World Cups have undertaken to date , since the pioneer , in 1930 , until the consecration of the pentacampeonato Brazil in 2002 for All . commemorate the centenary of FIFA - Federation International de Football Association (1904/2004) - the world governing body for Football . Bringing angles and special footage that have not been seen in television broadcasts Fifa Fever - The Best Soccer History is carefully divided into chapters that make the delight of fans of the most popular sport in the world . Among them are:

- The great teams in history - Hungary 54 , Brazil 58 , Brazil 70 and Holland 74 .
- The best players of all time , divided by position ( Goalkeepers , Defenders , midfielders and attackers ) .
- Major controversies and refereeing errors .
- The shows part of every crowd .
- The big games , bigger decisions and fiercest rivalries .
- The best goals in World Cup history , divided into categories ( Long Distance Shots , headers , set pieces , Played Played in Individual and Team ) .
- The funniest mistakes , blunders, and so-called lost goals " that even my mother would " ...
- Technical epoch .
- The great " face " that turned losses that seemed inevitable in memorable victories .
- The greatest players of all time .
- Absences and most violent fights .
- The evolution of fashion and marketing of Football .
All this and much more in 3 hours and 15 minutes of a must-see film that every football fan should have at home.

extras:
